acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.4microg/L of Crustacea (Brown shrimp) (EHC91, 1989).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on the value (50mg/kg) calculated from rat LD50 (60, 50, and 120mg/kg (PD 17 (1975), EHC 91 (1989), ACGIH (7th, 2001), and PIM 575 (1975)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 1 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50; VALUE: 0.013mg/L"(RTECS, 2005)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on the description (PATTY 4th.1994, Priority 1) that LD50 in humans is 5mg/kg.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into group 3 according to IARC (1987), into A4 according to ACGIH (proposal year 1995, 7th, 2001), into B2 according to EPA (the 1986 evaluation, (IRIS, 2005)), and into category 3 according to EU (proposal year unknown, EU ANNEX I and 2005). And evaluation of IARC was respected and it carried out the outside of Category based on ACGIH (1995) which is latest assessment.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1,not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)), and bioaccumulative (BCF=14500 (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available. Slightly corrosive to metals(HSDB, Access on Dec. 2005)

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories. Based on the report that results from dominant lethal tests in mice, chromosome aberration tests in Chinese hamster bone-marrow cells, reciprocal translocation tests in mice, chromosome aberration tests in rats and mice and micronucleus tests in mice (JMPR 1977, EHC 91 1989) are all negative.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine) and these elements are chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since there is the description that there is the lesion in neonatal's brain at the dose cause the toxicity in the maternal animals of rat (JMPR 1979, EHC 91, 1989), and it is indicated in the lack of irreversible and congenital survival ability occur in the neonatal which was born from the maternal animals which is given the administration of test material in mouse, and additionally, it was indicated that this lack of survival ability and the decrease of nursing ability of the maternal animal cause the increase child mortality (EHC 91, 1989), it is classified into the Category 1B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (central nervous systems, liver), since the workers in Dieldrin manufacture got poisoning, and occured the central nervous system symptoms (JMPR/1970, 1977, EHC 91, 1989, ACGIH 4th. 1994), and the central nervous system symptomsin dogs and rats (JMPR 1970, and EHC 91, 1989 and MOE Risk Assessment/-- the 1st volume, 2002) , and rodent ulcer of liver in rats by a chlorinated hydrocarbonic insecticide were both acknowledged by the dosage of guidance value within the limits of Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In humans, central-nerve neurosis such as spasm is identified with 5mg/kg set to LD50 (PATTY, 4th.1994), and it had an influence with the mouse on its central nerve systems enhancing the effects of seizure inducers, etc. (JMPR 1967). So it was set as Category 1(central nervous systems).
